oracle_info.speaker: The Chair (Hon. Anthony Rota (NipissingTimiskaming, Lib.))
oracle_info.content: We will now move on to document submissions.

oracle_info.speaker: The Chair
oracle_info.content: On tabling of documents, we have Minister Sajjan.

oracle_info.speaker: The Chair
oracle_info.content: Now we'll go to presenting petitions.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Elizabeth May (SaanichGulf Islands, GP)
oracle_info.content: Chair, I rise to present two petitions.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Richard Cannings (South OkanaganWest Kootenay, NDP)
oracle_info.content: Chair, I rise here today to present a petition from Canadian citizens in support of motion M-1, which was placed in this House by my colleague the member for New WestminsterBurnaby on the green new deal.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Gord Johns (CourtenayAlberni, NDP)
oracle_info.content: Chair, it's an honour and privilege to table e-petition 2577, which was sponsored by Chris Alemany from Port Alberni and is supported by 5,183 petitioners.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Elizabeth May (SaanichGulf Islands, GP)
oracle_info.content: They both pertain to the protection of our natural world.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Elizabeth May (SaanichGulf Islands, GP)
oracle_info.content: The petitioners call on the Government of Canada to practise a precautionary principle and remove from use neonicotinoids in Canada to protect our pollinators.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Elizabeth May (SaanichGulf Islands, GP)
oracle_info.content: The petitioners are calling for more action to be taken as the population of southern resident killer whales continues to decline, more action for boat-free safety zones, more prohibitions around whale tourism to make sure that the whales are safe from those who are keen to watch them from too close a distance, and more of a credible enforcement regime to support these measures to keep the southern resident killer whale population in our waters and not on the list of species that have become extinct.

oracle_info.speaker: The Chair
oracle_info.content: Now we'll go to Statements by Members.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Paul Lefebvre (Sudbury, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: I am proud of all my constituents, and all Canadians, including first responders, volunteers, health care and essential workers, local miners, the farmers and produce growers who are feeding our families, and local businesses who are staying connected with their staff.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Mike Kelloway (Cape BretonCanso, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: Chair, over the last few months I have watched constituents in my riding come together to look out for one another during these challenging times.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Majid Jowhari (Richmond Hill, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: Week after week residents and organizations have come together to support our most vulnerable during a time of great difficulty.

oracle_info.speaker: The Chair
oracle_info.content: We now begin the period of questions for ministers.

oracle_info.speaker: Hon. Andrew Scheer
oracle_info.content: We want the Auditor General to be able to examine that government spending.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Bryan May (Cambridge, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: Would the minister inform the House about the government's plans to support Canadians with disabilities who are experiencing increased costs due to COVID-19?

specific_query_list.query: What were the statements discussed by the members?

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Paul Lefebvre (Sudbury, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: Chair, I just want to say thank you to the industrious people of Sudbury who have risen to the challenge and joined forces in the face of COVID-19.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Paul Lefebvre (Sudbury, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: I am proud of all my constituents, and all Canadians, including first responders, volunteers, health care and essential workers, local miners, the farmers and produce growers who are feeding our families, and local businesses who are staying connected with their staff.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Paul Lefebvre (Sudbury, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: I also salute all our homegrown innovations such as ProStitch and King Sportswear face masks; Crosscut Distillery hand sanitizer; Nobel Prize winner SNOLAB's work on ventilators, which earned a federal contract; Vale Canada's $1 million in seed capital to small firms developing COVID-19 health solutions; and many more.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Steven MacKinnon (Gatineau, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: Mr.Chair, on behalf of myself and my parliamentary colleagues, I want to congratulate students from our high school class of 2020.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Steven MacKinnon (Gatineau, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: We know that, owing to the pandemic, graduation celebrations will be different this year, as students will be deprived of their prom, their graduation ceremony and, in some cases, their goodbyes to friends and teachers.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Steven MacKinnon (Gatineau, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: However, that takes nothing away from their accomplishment.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Steven MacKinnon (Gatineau, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: The class of 2020 will be remembered for a long time.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Leah Gazan (Winnipeg Centre, NDP)
oracle_info.content: Chair, today I rise to honour Justice 4 Black Lives Winnipeg, led by women and non-binary individuals, who stood together and mobilized our city to state clearly that we will not stand by and stay silent in the face of police brutality.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Leah Gazan (Winnipeg Centre, NDP)
oracle_info.content: We will speak out against systemic racism.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Leah Gazan (Winnipeg Centre, NDP)
oracle_info.content: To all the women and non-binary folks who are standing, I say, let's continue to sound our voices in solidarity and support of one another until indigenous and black lives are honoured and respected.

specific_query_list.query: What was the Prime minister and Government accused of?

oracle_info.speaker: Mrs. Rosemarie Falk (BattlefordsLloydminster, CPC)
oracle_info.content: Chair, the Liberal government has tabled $87 billion in spending and allocated just four hours for Parliament to study, debate and pass it.

oracle_info.speaker: Mrs. Rosemarie Falk (BattlefordsLloydminster, CPC)
oracle_info.content: The allocated time is wholly inadequate.

oracle_info.speaker: Mrs. Rosemarie Falk (BattlefordsLloydminster, CPC)
oracle_info.content: They deserve to know that this government spending was scrutinized and passed through the rigours of Parliament.

oracle_info.speaker: Hon. Andrew Scheer (Leader of the Opposition)
oracle_info.content: Chair, the Prime Minister is doing everything to avoid being accountable to Canadians.

oracle_info.speaker: Hon. Andrew Scheer (Leader of the Opposition)
oracle_info.content: He is refusing to table a budget, refusing to provide an economic update and refusing to let the House of Commons do its work.

specific_query_list.query: Which groups did the members discuss to have been impacted heavily?

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Sylvie Brub (AbitibiBaie-JamesNunavikEeyou, BQ)
oracle_info.content: Mr.Chair, unacceptable incidents of police brutality against aboriginals have prompted former member Romeo Saganash, whose commitment I commend, to call for a commission of inquiry similar to the Viens commission in Quebec.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Steven MacKinnon (Gatineau, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: Mr.Chair, on behalf of myself and my parliamentary colleagues, I want to congratulate students from our high school class of 2020.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Steven MacKinnon (Gatineau, Lib.)
oracle_info.content: We know that, owing to the pandemic, graduation celebrations will be different this year, as students will be deprived of their prom, their graduation ceremony and, in some cases, their goodbyes to friends and teachers.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Brad Vis (MissionMatsquiFraser Canyon, CPC)
oracle_info.content: The sad reality is that even before the crisis hit, most rural Canadians simply did not have access to a strong and stable Internet connection, even though Internet is an essential service.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Brad Vis (MissionMatsquiFraser Canyon, CPC)
oracle_info.content: For many of my indigenous constituents, Internet services are stuck in the 1990s because telecom companies don't want to serve them.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Brad Vis (MissionMatsquiFraser Canyon, CPC)
oracle_info.content: We call on the government to outline and implement a concrete action plan to address Internet connectivity deficits between rural and urban Canada.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Leah Gazan (Winnipeg Centre, NDP)
oracle_info.content: Chair, today I rise to honour Justice 4 Black Lives Winnipeg, led by women and non-binary individuals, who stood together and mobilized our city to state clearly that we will not stand by and stay silent in the face of police brutality.

specific_query_list.query: What was said about the Auditor General?

oracle_info.speaker: Hon. Andrew Scheer (Leader of the Opposition)
oracle_info.content: Will he at least provide the Auditor General with the additional funding she needs to look into government expenditures?

oracle_info.speaker: Right Hon. Justin Trudeau
oracle_info.content: Chair, we worked with the Auditor General to increase the funding of the Auditor General's office in 2018-19, and the equivalent of 38 full-time staff were added.

oracle_info.speaker: Hon. Andrew Scheer
oracle_info.content: Only the government's refusal to grant that extra funding is hampering the Auditor General's ability to give Canadians the answers they deserve, and we wonder why.

specific_query_list.query: What was the issue around the CERB?

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Jagmeet Singh
oracle_info.content: We're asking the Prime Minister to extend the CERB for families in need.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Jagmeet Singh (Burnaby South, NDP)
oracle_info.content: Mr.Chair, will the Prime Minister make a clear and direct commitment today to extend the CERB for families who need it?

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Jagmeet Singh
oracle_info.content: Chair, a family that needs to buy groceries can't take those pretty words and buy groceries with them.

oracle_info.speaker: Mr. Jagmeet Singh
oracle_info.content: He is now dependent on the CERB.

specific_query_list.query: Summarize what was said on the GBA+ analysis?

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Jag Sahota
oracle_info.content: Had the government conducted a GBA+ analysis, they would have discovered this prior to rolling out inadequate programs for women.

oracle_info.speaker: Ms. Jag Sahota
oracle_info.content: Why was GBA+ analysis not conducted for the COVID-19 relief programs?

oracle_info.speaker: Hon. Carla Qualtrough
oracle_info.content: Madam Chair, as I said, the needs of women and girls were taken into consideration every step of the way, from the beginning, as we worked to provide a comprehensive suite of support for Canadians across the country.

oracle_info.speaker: Hon. Carla Qualtrough
oracle_info.content: I'll say again how important it was from the very beginning that we took into account the needs of women and girls, and as we move forward into the economic recovery phase, how completely we make women at the core of every decision.
